1159. What sacrifice are we ready to make that we may find the lost pearl, and place it in the hands of 
                                                                           277
our Saviour? The cities are teeming with iniquity; Satan suggests that it is impossible to do any good within their borders, and so they are sadly neglected. But there are lost pearls there, whose value you cannot realize until you earnestly seek to find them. There might be one hundred workers where there is but one seeking diligently, prayerfully, and with intense interest to find the pearls that are buried in the rubbish of these cities.--R. and H., 1896, No. 16.
